How many people are affected by hereditary antithrombin deficiency ?,"Hereditary antithrombin deficiency is estimated to occur in about 1 in 2,000 to 3,000 individuals. Of people who have experienced an abnormal blood clot, about 1 in 20 to 200 have hereditary antithrombin deficiency.",GHR,hereditary antithrombin deficiency
